title: tRNA gene/RNA element boundary detector
description: This feature detects tRNA genes and potentially other structured RNA elements in bacterial genomes. The activation consistently appears as a sharp spike at a specific position within or adjacent to these RNA elements. In section_4, it activates near tRNA-fMet (tRNA) and in section_2 near tRNA-Ala. The feature appears to recognize sequence or structural motifs that define these RNA elements, particularly at boundaries or transition points. This likely represents recognition of conserved sequence patterns involved in RNA processing, transcription termination/initiation, or structured RNA elements. The pattern is highly consistent across examples where RNA elements are present, suggesting it captures an important functional element for gene expression regulation.
